page.title: 01General Introduction
page.content: This block of land is bisected by the River Dee, the Afon Dyfrdwy, and by the border between England and Wales,(parts of Shropshire and Clwyd).Place names on either side of the border are found in both languages. Trees and grass cover most of the area. On one side of the river is the English hamlet of Sodylt and on the other the Welsh village of Erbistock. There is no road bridge over the river and in order to gain access one has to make a detour on the B5069 via Overton bridge. Information is included on the following:samples of the{ 20 farms}in the block, the{only two}units of industrial trade, and for the visitor we have included some places of interest, two churches, a riding school, an inn and the River Dee.
